TopicTitle: If you happen to be in London at the moment....

Articles.Content:
I don't post often, well let's be honest I think it's been a year since I've eveb played KSP but that's my problem...

Anyway, if you happen to be in London this autumn, the Science Museum is hosting a Cosmonauts exhibition, featuring some of the milestones of the Soviet space programme. Highlights (for me) were an experimental ejector seat for cosmo-dogs and an amazing feature on Valentina Kerman... er Tereshkova... including her actual Vostok capsule, as well as Yuri (of course). \i wonder is Yuri the Russian for Jebediah?

For balance, if you're interested, the Apollo 10 Command Module is downstairs, along with a LEM mock-up and loads of other Western space science. It's just rare to see the Russian stuff over here.

It's about Ã‚Â£15 to get in, but as someone who coughed up, it's well worth it...if only for the space toilet and the zero gravity shower....

Fly (as Scott Manley would say) Safe...
A friend of mine told me exactly this a couple of days ago. Apparently it is well worth the hassle.

an experimental ejector seat for cosmo-dogs

Wow. I knew they sent dogs and other animals, I didn't know they designed ejector seats for them. Very cool.

I went there last year. It was awesome. Besides the space stuff, there's a lot of other cool things there.

It also helps that I spent my time there with a group of English girls. Foreigners for the win!
